001package ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.capture;
002
003/**
004 * Immutable representation of a captured TCP segment persisted by RADAR.
005 *
006 * @param timestampMicros capture timestamp in microseconds since epoch
007 * @param srcIp source IP address (IPv4/IPv6 string)
008 * @param srcPort source TCP port
009 * @param dstIp destination IP address
010 * @param dstPort destination TCP port
011 * @param sequence TCP sequence number as observed on the wire
012 * @param flags bitmask of TCP control flags (see constants)
013 * @param payload captured TCP payload bytes; defensively copied
014 * @implNote The payload array is cloned during construction to preserve immutability.
015 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
016 */
017public record SegmentRecord(
018    long timestampMicros,
019    String srcIp,
020    int srcPort,
021    String dstIp,
022    int dstPort,
023    long sequence,
024    int flags,
025    byte[] payload) {
026  /**
027   * Normalizes the segment payload and ensures null-safe arrays.
028   *
029   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
030   */
031  public SegmentRecord {
032    payload = payload != null ? payload.clone() : new byte[0];
033  }
034
035  /** TCP FIN flag mask. */
036  public static final int FIN = 1;
037  /** TCP SYN flag mask. */
038  public static final int SYN = 2;
039  /** TCP RST flag mask. */
040  public static final int RST = 4;
041  /** TCP PSH flag mask. */
042  public static final int PSH = 8;
043  /** TCP ACK flag mask. */
044  public static final int ACK = 16;
045}
